Package lepton.util

Class ImageUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • lepton.util.ImageUtil
  • public class ImageUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Util class for doing image operations. Operations are done with BufferedImages, and operations are cached. The caching system is a little confusing, but you shouldn't have to worry about it too much. The one useful function here is getImage.

                                                 float h,

                                                 boolean cache)
        Kind of like the "frontend" for the rehue op. This will check cache and only rehue if not cached.

      • getImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage​(java.io.InputStream stream)
                                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Gets an image from an inputStream

      • getImage_fname

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage_fname​(java.lang.String fname,
                                                          java.lang.String ext)
                                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Like getImage(InputStream), but with functionality to obtain the inputstream itself. Fname would be something like "image" or "image integrated", and ext would be ".jpg". " integrated" will be used to determine whether or not the file is packaged within the extra source folder within the jarfile. Uses lepton.util.Util.getOptionallyIntegratedStream internally.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • getImage_handleNotFound

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage_handleNotFound​(java.io.InputStream stream)
